nodes.text: Oh my, I've said more than I should already. Never mind, and if anybody asks I didn't say anything.
Well then, we've nothing to talk about. Good day.

You? Oh, no - the serum's not refined enough to handle such a low mutagenic quotient. It must be used on a super-mutant. Inject the serum into a super-mutant and then come back and report the results. I understand Broken Hills is full of them.
You misunderstood. I said it would remove their mutagenic potential. The process does seem violent on the system, though. Oh well, more refining to do.
Well, if you don't mind, would you please get on with it? I'm not a young man anymore.
So, how did it go? Is the test done?
It's no use, I'm not going back. None of you appreciated the work I was doing, so don't pretend to be my friend. Thank you very much!
Kiss my ass, you cretin! Guards! Guards!
I've prepared a small sample of the serum but it needs to be injected into a host.

Something about extreme sociological conditioning. Mind you, I thought it was all so much mumbo-jumbo, no real science in it at all. But I did hear something about 13 having to be improvised during the course of the experiment. Sloppy work, I'd say.
The Chosen One? Of course, that makes sense. Interesting... I'm afraid I can't help you. I was assigned to cyber-genetics research, not the Vault Behavioral Project.
Of course. The cyberdog is all yours. Now, I have work to do.

Of course, my simple-minded colleagues were just trying to solve the whole problem the crudest way possible. Purification, indeed. I'll admit there were some early problems, but I've got them worked out now...I think.
I'm , the Chosen One. I'm looking for Vault 13.
Still some bugs, I see. Well, try and try again.
In fact, you could help me perform the field testing. Interested?

Well, it should cause a regression in the genetic matrix that results in the destabilization and assimilation of abberant DNA, leaving the host free of mutagenic potential. If I knew for sure, I wouldn't need you to test it.

You'll be participating in an important experiment, in fact, the most important, scientific-oh, you mean money. Well, I do have a Cyber-Hound Mk. II, Personal Security Model, that I brought with me. I suppose I could have it activated and on-line by the time you got back. Would that do?
Hmm, sub-par cranial development... Stunted intellectual development. No gross physical mutation, though. No, you just simply won't do, I'm afraid. Good day.
And... How did it work?
Excellent. Here's the serum, fitted up in an stim hypo. All you have to do is use it on a super-mutant and then report back to me. Like I said, Broken Hills - that's the place to look. Good luck.
You again? What do you want?
Tell your Mr. Merk that my answer hasn't changed. I have no interest in any of his "joint ventures." Thank you and good day.
Caught you again, huh? Fine, I'll let the law deal with you. Guards! Guards!
...so the mutation rate stablizes over-don't bother me now.

links.text: You're a monster! I want nothing to do with you.
Now you're being reasonable. I'll let Mr. Merk know.
I'm not letting you stick any needles in me!
That's it, I'm out of here.
You expect me to believe any of this? You are a loon.
Right. You're mad as a hatter. Goodbye.
Cyber-genetics? I don't remember ever studying that one.
Ever heard of a place called the Enclave?
Enough chit-chat. You've got some papers Mr. Merk wants. Hand em over and nobody gets hurt.
You're a monster! I want nothing to do with you.
Field testing? What do you mean?
You are out of your mind. Just completely loony.
It killed him! You said it would cure mutants!
Enough chit-chat. You've got some papers Mr. Merk wants. Hand em over and nobody gets hurt.
Ever heard of a place called the Enclave?
Good day, my ass, bucko, I'm here to be polite. You hand over those papers or I'll start removing fingers. Let's see how good of a doc you are then.
